Key Arguments: The bill gives excessive power to ACMA, which could lead to censorship and suppression of free speech.
There is a double standard as government-approved media outlets are exempt from the legislation.
The definitions of misinformation and disinformation could implicate the government and media themselves.
The bill could burden freedom of political communication.
Misinformation should be addressed through open debate and discussion, not government regulation.
Main Themes: Skepticism towards government and media narratives
Importance of open debate and public discourse
Notable Quotes: The Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation Bill 2023 is an attempt by the Labor government along side the ACMA to further over reach into the already mass regulated realm of online communication.

Misinformation and disinformation will be effectively exposed and disposed of naturally through open criticism, discussion and debate and most certainly not by the opinion of a government organisation.
The idea that any singular group or more precisely, a government organisation (the ACMA for example) can claim to know and declare what is or isnâ€™t mis/disinformation is ludicrous.
